topic.title: The SMT Warning light comes ON or a Buzzing Noise is heard and cannot shift

section.p: The SMT Warning light comes ON or a Buzzing Noise is heard and cannot shift

li.p: A. A BUZZING NOISE IS HEARD FROM ENGINE COMPARTMENT OR CANNOT SHIFT
B. CUSTOMER PROBLEM ANALYSIS CHECK
C. REPLACE THE TRANSAXLE OIL SEAL RING

section.p: A. A BUZZING NOISE IS HEARD FROM ENGINE COMPARTMENT OR CANNOT SHIFT

li.p: Problem Symptom:
Case 1:
The SMT warning light comes ON and a buzzing noise is heard from the engine compartment.
Case 2:
The SMT warning light comes ON and shift state cannot be changed.
DTC No.:
Case 1:
Case 2:
Probable cause:
Overview of operation:
Case 1:
When the ambient temperature becomes low, fluid seepage from the transaxle oil seal ring is seen, leading to insufficient accumulated pressure.
Case 2:

SMT fluid is hygroscopic and its viscosity (viscous drag) increases after absorbing moisture and the HPU assembly may not be able to generate sufficient pressure. In this case, may result in a shift malfunction due to insufficient driving force of the GSA assembly. Besides, DTCs P0942, P0919, P1873, P1880, etc. may be stored due to shift malfunction or insufficient pressure.
Case 1:

When the input of the diagnosis code related to HPU accumulated pressure (P1880 for the models before Aug. 2002 and P0942 for the models after Aug. 2002) is found and fluid seepage from the sealed area between the reservoir cap cover and HPU body assembly is seen, replace the transaxle oil seal ring with the service parts.
Case 2:

When an engine stall due to a shift malfunction occurred, besides engine stall related DTCs, P1646 (SMT ECU malfunction) and P1647 (SMT-EFI communication error) may also output. After the SMT system detects a malfunction, it may output engine stall request signal to the engine ECU by its fail-safe function and store DTCs. Therefore, above 2 DTCs may not indicate SMT ECU malfunction or SMT-EFI communication error. If other DTCs (P0942, P0919, etc.) are also output, troubleshoot them first.
CUSTOMER PROBLEM ANALYSIS CHECK
(a) According to Customer Problem Analysis Check, interview the customer about the detailed condition when the malfunction occurred.
CHECK DTC OUTPUT
(a) Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
(b) Turn the ignition switch to ON.
(c) Turn the GTS on.
(d) Check the DTCs.
CHECK IF THERE IS ANY SMT FLUID LEAKAGE
(a) Check that there is no SMT fluid blotting or leaks from the reservoir cap cover or HPU assembly seal.

entry.p: SMT fluid blotting or leaks is found
SMT fluid blotting or leaks is not found

li.p: REPLACE THE TRANSAXLE OIL SEAL RING
(a) Drain all SMT fluid from the SMT system.
(b) According to REPLACE THE TRANSAXLE OIL SEAL RING procedure, replace the transaxle oil seal ring.

note.p: Drain all SMT fluid from the SMT system before replacing the transaxle oil seal ring.

li.p: CONFIRMATION AFTER REPAIR
(a) Confirm that the system is returned to normal.

note.p: If the system still malfunctions, troubleshoot according to the DTCs and problem symptoms table.

div.p: The system is returned to normal.

ul.li:
NG
Troubleshoot according to the DTCs and problem symptoms table.

section.p: B. CUSTOMER PROBLEM ANALYSIS CHECK (General country use only)
C. REPLACE THE TRANSAXLE OIL SEAL RING

li.p: REMOVE THE AIR CLEANER ASSEMBLY
CLEAN THE AREA AROUND THE RESERVOIR TANK
Clean fluid that has seeped out from the surrounding of the reservoir tank of the sequential transmission pump assembly with brake cleaner, etc. and then apply air.
REMOVE THE RESERVOIR TANK
Extract the fluid from the reservoir tank (approx. 400cc).

note.p: If the vent hole of the cap is closed after extraction (with 90080-30087, etc.), the amount of fluid dripped during the removal of the reservoir cap cover can be reduced.

li.p: Remove the sequential transmission pump bracket and 3 fixing bolts for higher working efficiency.
Remove the reservoir tank using a T20 “TORX” socket wrench.
REPLACE THE TRANSAXLE OIL SEAL RING
Remove the 2 transaxle oil seal rings using a thin standard-tip screwdriver.

note.p: If dirt is found inside port, wipe it off with a paper waste cloth, etc.

li.p: Install the new service parts of the transaxle oil seal rings.

note.p: The shape of the transaxle oil seal ring was changed to the O-ring shape and has no assembling direction.

li.p: INSTALL THE RESERVOIR TANK
Install the reservoir tank with the 4 bolts.
Install the sequential transmission pump bracket with the 3 bolts.
REPLENISH THE SMT FLUID
Replenish the SMT fluid until it reaches the Low level, release the accumulator pressure and then replenish the SMT fluid until it reaches the UPP level.

note.p: When replacing the transaxle oil seal ring, make sure to replace SMT fluid in the SMT system.

li.p: Open the driver side’s door and check the fluid level and for fluid seepage (after stop of HPU).
INSTALL THE AIR CLEANER ASSEMBLY
